Resources

Philosophy Resources

  • The American Philosophical Association
  • Episteme Links
  • The Stanford Encyclopedia of Philosophy
  • The Internet Encyclopedia of Philosophy
  • Free Philosophy Dictionary
  • Garth Kemerling’s Philosophy Pages
  • PhilPapers
  • WIPHI Philosophy Videos

Reading & Writing Philosophy

  • Jim Pryor’s guide to reading and writing philosophy.
  • A Guide to Philosophical Writing
  • ‘Improving Academic Writing’, by Jonathan Bennett and Samuel Gorovitz.

General Writing Resources

  • `Style: Lessons in Clarity and Grace’, by J. Williams and J. Bizup is my preferred writing guidebook.
  • Citing other work

Critical Thinking Resources

  • Jim Pryor on Philosophical Terms and Methods.
  • Wi-Phi has a series of short videos on critical thinking
  • Critical thinking glossaries here and here.
  • I use ‘The Power of Critical Thinking’, by Lewis Vaughn in my critical thinking classes. The textbook’s companion website has self assessment quizzes and other useful tools.

Sundry Resources

  • Freedom saves you from distraction.
  • The Pomodoro Technique boosts productivity.
  • Mou is a clean, nice markdown editor.
  • Pandoc for document coversion.
  • Bibdesk for reference management.
